intro: Ajania remotipinna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ajania, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color and are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Ajania remotipinna is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
